intro: Endlicheria boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, typically pink or white, and its preference for high-altitude, temperate climates. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds enclosed in a capsule. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
